Millet Porridge.instructions: Rinse the millets thoroughly and soak them in water for 30 minutes. In a pan, boil the milk and add soaked millets. Stir continuously and cook for 10 minutes until soft. Add honey for sweetness and top with chopped nuts before serving.

Ragi Ball.instructions: Boil water in a pan and add a pinch of salt. Gradually add ragi flour while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. Cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat until the dough forms a thick consistency. Roll into small balls and serve with curry or chutney.

Foxtail Millet Soup.instructions: Rinse the foxtail millet and soak for 20 minutes. In a pot, heat a little oil, add cumin seeds, and sauté the chopped vegetables. Add soaked millet, water, salt, and black pepper. Cook for 15-20 minutes until everything is soft. Blend if a smooth consistency is preferred.

Jowar Roti.instructions: In a bowl, mix jowar flour with salt. Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft dough. Divide into small portions and roll into thin rotis using a rolling pin. Cook on a hot pan for 2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Serve with curry.

Bajra Khichdi.instructions: Rinse bajra and moong dal well. In a pressure cooker, heat oil, add cumin seeds, chopped tomatoes, and turmeric powder. Add bajra, moong dal, and 2 cups of water. Cook for 3-4 whistles. Serve warm with yogurt or pickles.

Quinoa Salad.instructions: Cook quinoa as per instructions and let it cool. Mix with chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Toss well and serve fresh as a healthy salad.

Brown Rice and Dal.instructions: Rinse brown rice and dal separately. Cook rice with 2 cups of water. In another pan, cook dal with turmeric and salt until soft. Heat oil, add cumin seeds, and pour the dal over it.

Oats Upma.instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add grated carrots and peas, sauté for 2 minutes. Add oats and mix well. Pour in 1 cup water and cook for 3-4 minutes. Serve warm.

Vegetable Millet Pulao.instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add chopped vegetables, and sauté for 3 minutes. Add millets, garam masala, and 2 cups of water. Cover and cook on low flame for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Ragi Idli.instructions: Soak urad dal for 4 hours and grind into a smooth paste. Mix with ragi flour, add salt, and ferment overnight. Pour into idli molds and steam for 10-12 minutes. Serve hot with chutney.

Pumpkin Soup.instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in a pan. Add diced pumpkin and cook for 10 minutes. Blend until smooth, add coconut milk, and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Banana Pancakes.instructions: Mash banana in a bowl. Add oats, egg, and milk. Mix into a smooth batter. Heat a pan, pour small portions, and cook on medium heat until golden brown. Serve with honey or yogurt.

Tomato Rasam.instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped tomatoes and tamarind paste. Cook until tomatoes soften. Add 2 cups water and black pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Sprouted Moong Salad.instructions: Mix sprouted moong with chopped tomato and cucumber. Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste. Toss well and serve fresh as a light and nutritious salad.

Mixed Millet Dosa.instructions: Mix all flours with yogurt, salt, and enough water to form a smooth batter. Let it rest for 30 minutes. Pour a ladleful of batter onto a hot pan and spread in a circular motion. Cook on medium heat until golden brown. Serve with chutney.

Methi Thepla.instructions: Mix flour with methi leaves, turmeric, salt, and carom seeds. Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. Roll into thin circles and cook on a pan with minimal oil until golden brown.

Lemon Millet Rice.instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add green chili, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix in cooked little millet and stir well. Finish with lemon juice and serve warm.

Palak Dal (Spinach Lentils).instructions: Cook toor dal with turmeric until soft. In another pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté onions and tomatoes until soft, then add chopped spinach. Combine with dal and simmer for 5 minutes.

Sweet Potato Mash.instructions: Boil and mash sweet potato until smooth. Mix in cinnamon powder and honey. Top with chopped nuts if desired. Serve warm or chilled.

Chia Pudding.instructions: Mix chia seeds with almond milk and honey. Stir well and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, top with chopped fruits.

Tomato Quinoa Soup.instructions: In a pot, heat a little oil and sauté carrots. Add blended tomatoes, cumin powder, salt, and pepper. Stir in cooked quinoa and let it simmer for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Banana Ragi Porridge.instructions: Mix ragi flour with milk in a pot. Cook on low heat, stirring continuously until thick. Add mashed banana and jaggery for sweetness. Serve warm.

Beetroot Millet Cutlets.instructions: Mix all ingredients together into a dough. Shape into small patties and shallow fry on a pan until golden brown. Serve with mint chutney.

Green Gram (Moong) Dal.instructions: Cook green gram with turmeric until soft. In another pan, sauté onions and tomatoes, then add the cooked dal. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve.

Masala Millet Poha.instructions: Soak millet poha in water for 2 minutes and drain. Heat oil, add mustard seeds and sauté vegetables. Add turmeric and salt, mix in poha, and cook for 2 minutes.

Ragi Mudde.instructions: Boil water in a pot and add salt. Gradually add ragi flour, stirring continuously. Once it thickens, turn off the heat and roll into balls. Serve hot with dal or chutney.

Millet Thali.instructions: Serve cooked millet alongside dal, vegetable sabzi, and curd as a complete meal.

Spinach Bajra Paratha.instructions: Mix all ingredients into a soft dough. Roll into flat parathas and cook on a pan with minimal oil.

Lauki (Bottle Gourd) Sabzi.instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped lauki. Add turmeric and salt. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.

Dal Tadka.instructions: Cook dal with turmeric. In another pan, heat oil and sauté onions, tomatoes, mustard, and cumin seeds. Mix into the dal and serve hot.

Barnyard Millet Pongal.instructions: Roast barnyard millet and moong dal separately. Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds and black pepper. Add roasted millet, moong dal, and 2 cups of water. Cover and cook for 10 minutes until soft. Serve hot.

Bajra Methi Poori.instructions: Mix all ingredients with enough water to form a stiff dough. Roll into small discs and deep fry in hot oil until golden brown. Serve with yogurt or pickles.

Ragi Banana Smoothie.instructions: Blend ragi flour, banana, milk, and honey until smooth. Serve chilled as a nutritious smoothie.

Jowar Upma.instructions: Dry roast jowar rava for 2 minutes. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, and sauté vegetables. Add jowar rava, 2 cups of water, and salt. Cook until soft.

Bajra Vegetable Cheela.instructions: Mix all ingredients with enough water to make a thin batter. Pour onto a hot pan, spread evenly, and cook on both sides until golden brown.

Foxtail Millet Kheer.instructions: Cook foxtail millet in water until soft. Add milk, stir continuously, and simmer for 5 minutes. Sweeten with jaggery and garnish with nuts.

Multigrain Roti.instructions: Mix all flours with salt and enough water to form a soft dough. Roll into rotis and cook on a pan until golden brown.

Lauki Bajra Paratha.instructions: Mix all ingredients into a dough. Roll into parathas and cook on a pan with minimal oil until golden brown.

Rajgira (Amaranth) Puri.instructions: Mix ingredients into a firm dough. Roll into small discs and deep fry in oil until puffed and golden brown.

Kodo Millet Fried Rice.instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté vegetables until slightly soft. Add cooked kodo millet, soy sauce, salt, and black pepper. Stir fry for 3 minutes and serve hot.

Sweet Corn & Millet Soup.instructions: Blend half the sweet corn into a puree. Heat water in a pan, add corn puree, whole corn, cooked millet, and seasoning. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

Jackfruit Biryani.instructions: Sauté onions in oil, add jackfruit pieces and spices. Cook until soft. Mix with cooked brown rice and simmer for 5 minutes.

Barnyard Millet Payasam.instructions: Cook millet in water until soft. Add coconut milk and jaggery, simmer for 5 minutes. Garnish with nuts and serve warm.

Peanut Jaggery Balls.instructions: Grind peanuts coarsely, mix with melted jaggery. Shape into small balls and let them cool.

Ragi Coconut Ladoo.instructions: Roast ragi flour in ghee until aromatic. Add grated coconut and jaggery, mix well. Shape into ladoos while warm.

Chickpea Wrap.instructions: Mash chickpeas and mix with vegetables and dressing. Spread on a roti, roll tightly, and serve.

Ragi Chocolate Muffins.instructions: Mix dry ingredients together. Add milk and stir into a smooth batter. Pour into muffin molds and bake at 180°C for 15 minutes.
